User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Affiliate AI Host platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user, matches Firebase Auth UID.

referredBy.description: ID of the affiliate who referred this user.

isAffiliate.description: Indicates whether the user is an affiliate.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the user account was created.

paypalEmail.description: The user's PayPal email for receiving payouts.

SubscriptionTier.title: SubscriptionTier
SubscriptionTier.description: Represents a subscription tier with its associated features and pricing.

id.description: Unique identifier for the subscription tier.

name.description: Name of the subscription tier (e.g., Starter, Growth, Pro, Enterprise).

dailyPrice.description: Daily price of the subscription tier.

hostingResources.description: Description of the web hosting resources included in this tier.

aiToolsAccess.description: Description of the AI tools access included in this tier.

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Represents a user's subscription to a specific tier.

endDate.description: Date when the subscription ends (or null if ongoing).

paypalSubscriptionId.description: The id of the user's subscription with paypal.

Referral.title: Referral
Referral.description: Represents a referral made by a user.

referrerId.description: Reference to User who made the referral. (Relationship: User 1:N Referral (as referrer))

referredUserId.description: Reference to User who was referred. (Relationship: User 1:N Referral (as referred))

referralDate.description: Date when the referral was made.

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: Represents a payment made to an affiliate or by a user.

userId.description: Reference to User who received the payment. (Relationship: User 1:N Payment)

paymentDate.description: Date when the payment was made.

type.description: The type of the payment - usually 'commission' or 'payout'.

Commission.title: Commission
Commission.description: Represents a commission earned by an affiliate.

affiliateId.description: Reference to User (as affiliate) who earned the commission. (Relationship: User 1:N Commission (as affiliate))

referralId.description: Reference to Referral that generated this commission. (Relationship: Referral 1:1 Commission)

subscriptionId.description: Reference to Subscription that generated this commission. (Relationship: Subscriptions 1:1 Commission)

AdminRole.title: Admin Role
AdminRole.description: An empty document whose existence at /roles_admin/{userId} grants a user admin privileges.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support Affiliate AI Host's affiliate marketing and subscription management features, prioritizing security, scalability, and ease of debugging. The key principle is Authorization Independence, achieved through denormalization of authorization data, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules.  This ensures atomic operations and simplifies security rule logic.  Data is segregated into collections with homogeneous security postures, enabling secure list operations (QAPs). User-owned data is organized under user-specific paths for simplified ownership-based security. The use of DBAC (database-based access control) eliminates custom claims.  Specifically: 

*   **Authorization Independence:** The structure avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies.  For instance, access to a user's subscriptions, referrals, and payments is controlled by the user's ID in the path (`/users/{userId}/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}`).  Since all documents under `/users/{userId}` are owned by that user, authorization is determined solely by matching `request.auth.uid` with the `userId` path parameter. 

*   **QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The segregation of user data into subcollections ensures that listing operations are secure and efficient. Listing `/users/{userId}/subscriptions` only returns subscriptions owned by that user.

*   **Affiliate Tracking & Commission:** When a new user signs up via an affiliate link, the `referredBy` field in the `/users` collection records the referring affiliate's ID. When the new user subscribes, the commission is generated in the commissions collection under the affiliates user ID path.
